casebody.data:
Thos. W. DELZELL and R. L. Clark, Independent Trustees of Portland Electric Power Company, a Corporation, Appellants, v. CENTRAL PUBLIC UTILITY CORPORATION, a Corporation. No. 8567. Circuit Court of Appeals, Third Circuit. Argued June 19, 1944. Decided June 27, 1944. E. F. Bernard, of Portland, Or. (Charles F. Richards, of Wilmington, Del., and Ralph H. King, of Portland, Or., on the brief), for appellants. James R. Morford, of Wilmington, Del. (David B. Landis, of New York City, Marvel & Morford, of Wilmington, Del., and Duke & Landis, of New York City, on the brief), for appellee.

Before BRATTON, JONES, and MCLAUGHLIN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment of the District Court, 56 F.Supp. 25, is affirmed on the basis of the substantially supported findings contained in the opinion of the learned trial judge and the conclusion of law appropriately applied thereto.
